body_html:
After browsing some of the code history, it looks like the current behavior was an explicit implementation choice made back in Nov 2015.

Here's the git commit that brought it in:
d50565b

For reference, the internal tracking ID is cl/107710311 and the description is:

Scope tensorflow logging to prevent namespace pollution for
users who import tf and configure their own loggers.

@dave-andersen and @mrry were involved in the original change, and may have more details. I'm re-assigning to @mrry since he knows Python much better than I do, and may have some opinions on the suggestion of setting propagate=False

body:
After browsing some of the code history, it looks like the current behavior was an explicit implementation choice made back in Nov 2015.

Here's the git commit that brought it in:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/d50565b35e886e7c3a201ea2f088790ed4b28de4

For reference, the internal tracking ID is cl/107710311 and the description is:
```
Scope tensorflow logging to prevent namespace pollution for
users who import tf and configure their own loggers.
```

@dave-andersen and @mrry were involved in the original change, and may have more details.  I'm re-assigning to @mrry since he knows Python much better than I do, and may have some opinions on the suggestion of setting `propagate=False`
